chart_metadata.name: minio
chart_metadata.description: High Performance, Kubernetes Native Object Storage

runAsContext.description: Minio can run as any non-root user.
Minio's logsearch can run as any non-root user.
Postgres runs as a non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for MinIO

attrs.label: Root User
attrs.description: The access key for the root user.

attrs.label: Root Password
attrs.description: The secret key for the root user.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description:
The user id that MinIO will run as.
Can't be changed after initial install.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description:
The group id that MinIO will run as.
Can't be changed after initial install.

attrs.label: API Port
attrs.description: The port for the MinIO API.

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description: The port for the MinIO Web UI.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>

attrs.label: Certificate
attrs.description: The certificate to use for MinIO

attrs.label: MinIO Server URL (API)
attrs.description:
The URL that console will use to reach API</br>
For example https://minio1.example.com.</br></br>

attrs.label: MinIO Browser Redirect URL
attrs.description:
The URL that console will provide as a redirect URL</br>
For example https://console.example.com.</br></br>

questions.label: Enable Multi Mode (SNMD or MNMD)
questions.description:
For Single Node Multi Drive (SNMD), the entry will look like this:</br>
Example Entry - /data{1...4}</br></br>
For Multi Node Multi Drive (MNMD), the entry will look like this:</br>
Example Entry - https://minio{1...3}.example.com:30000/data{1...4}</br></br>
Note that each host must use the same port number and the same number of storage items.</br>
In both cases /data{1...4} is the directories to be used for MinIO.
You have to add additional storage for each data entry.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Quiet

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for MinIO.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for MinIO.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.1.3.app_readme:
MinIO

MinIO is a High Performance Object Storage released under Apache License v2.0. It is API compatible with Amazon S3 cloud storage service. Use MinIO to build high performance infrastructure for machine learning, analytics and application data workloads.

During the installation process, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the MinIO data directory. Afterward, the MinIO container will run as a non-root user (568). Same applies to the postgres container. This will run afterwards as a non-root user (999). On each upgrade, a container will be launched with root privileges in order to apply the correct permissions to the postgres backups directory. Container that performs the backup will run as a non-root user (999) afterwards. Keep in mind the permissions on the backup directory will be changed to 999:999 on every update. But will only be changed once for the MinIO and postgres data directories.

When Multi Mode is enabled and entries contain :// (url) will enable Host Networking. Regardless of the selection in the Networking section.
1.1.3.detailed_readme:
MinIO

MinIO is a High Performance Object Storage released under Apache License v2.0. It is API compatible with Amazon S3 cloud storage service. Use MinIO to build high performance infrastructure for machine learning, analytics and application data workloads.

During the installation process, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the MinIO data directory. Afterward, the MinIO container will run as a non-root user (568). Same applies to the postgres container. This will run afterwards as a non-root user (999). On each upgrade, a container will be launched with root privileges in order to apply the correct permissions to the postgres backups directory. Container that performs the backup will run as a non-root user (999) afterwards. Keep in mind the permissions on the backup directory will be changed to 999:999 on every update. But will only be changed once for the MinIO and postgres data directories.

When Multi Mode is enabled and entries contain :// (url) will enable Host Networking. Regardless of the selection in the Networking section.
